docs.lead_paragraph: Results that come from a time prior to No Child Left Behind should be kept in mind when analyzing a new study that tries to determine if teachers have a lasting effect on students’ lives.

headline.seo: Study on Teacher Value Uses Data From Before Teach-to-Test Era
headline.main: Study on Teacher Value Uses Data From Before Teach-to-Test Era
headline.print_headline: Study on Teacher Value Uses Data From Before Teach-to-Test Era

docs.abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column holds that results that come from a time prior to No Child Left Behind should be kept in mind when analyzing a new study that tries to determine if teachers who helped raise students' test scores have a lasting effect on their lives.
docs.snippet: Results that come from a time prior to No Child Left Behind should be kept in mind when analyzing a new study that tries to determine if teachers have a lasting effect on students’ lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: An American author flies to Germany weighed down with 60 copies of a quixotic anthology.
docs.abstract: Joshua Cohen essay on the irony of traveling with dozens of copies of a book, to be distributed at a German book fair, in the era of the e-book.
docs.snippet: An American author flies to Germany weighed down with 60 copies of a quixotic anthology.

docs.lead_paragraph: A doctor volunteering in Haiti finds that it can be hard to do the right thing.
docs.abstract: Dr H Lee Kagan Lives essay recounts being reluctant to conduct a rape examination of a Haitian woman while volunteering at a hospital in Port-au-Prince due to his lack of practice, only to see her being treated callously by a nurse; says experience made him question who he was.
docs.snippet: A doctor volunteering in Haiti finds that it can be hard to do the right thing.
